main_definition: Packets are small portions or units of something, often wrapped in paper or plastic.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In computing and data transmission, packets refer to small chunks of data that are transmitted over a network.
meanings_and_examples.example: When browsing the internet, your requests for web pages are sent in packets.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Packets can also mean individual containers or wrappers used to hold food items such as snacks and candies.
meanings_and_examples.example: I bought a pack of cookies from the store.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In military context, packets may refer to small groups of soldiers or equipment.
meanings_and_examples.example: The army deployed in four packets along the border line.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Packets can also denote a portion of an event or activity that is scheduled for a particular time.
meanings_and_examples.example: There are three packet lunches at 12:00, 13:00 and 14:00.
